head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #41

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #41 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Clear, pleasantly cool weather, & wind from the Westward[.]
Cloudy, cold N:E: winds threatening snow, towards night commences snowing, continues to blow fresh, men commence chopping wood, again, Jonas Lamotte & self laying a platform on board the Nancy[.]

Disagreeable weather, snows all day with little intermission, wind from the Nouthward – Jonas & Lamo[tte] at the platform on board the Nancy, the others go to the woods (in the morning) and return ay about 9 AM, after which they pick oakum, making 10½lbs from old plat, put a keg of rum on tap.

Cloudy weather & looks like snow, wind changeable from NW to South, men employed cutting fire wood, Jonas & Lamotte finish with the platform – about noon of this day I was called in by the men, & shown their dinner, upon which I have some words with Jacob Hammond, Richard McGregor & Joseph Paquet, Jacob is very insolent, says that, "there is plenty work in the house & why don't I give them some that it is damn hard to be working in the snow." McGregor finds great fault with the provisions, & says "why don't you kill some of these cattle" (alluding to the Companies), accuses me of finding fault with them for not going out earlier to their work when all I said was to Evan the cook, that he should give them their breakfasts at Sunrise – borrowed 3lbs Candles from Mr Logan – 7 plank remain of the number Jonas sawed for the platform[.]

Clear pleasant weather, fresh breezes from the NW – men employed cutting fire wood, Jonas & Lamotte excepted, who are different jobs – putting a new post in the pump well, making a mould for head rails, bar for the F: T: S: bits, &c[.]
Pleasant weather, light winds from the NW, thaws considerably, men employed as usual cutting fire wood, Jonas & Lamotte getting ps for the head rails of the Nancy[.]
Cloudy cool weather wind from the Northward & West men employed as usual in the woods – the black smith bushes the peak ty block[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
